description:
At Williams, Ristoff & Proper, P.L.C., we help people through some of their toughest and most crucial moments. Our Palm Harbor, Florida, law firm takes personal injury, estate planning and bankruptcy cases. We strive to help our clients overcome obstacles on their path to a brighter future. Along the way, our team is committed to providing them with exceptional communication and steadfast support.

Our law firm has had significant success in personal injury cases such as car accident and medical malpractice cases. We have returned millions of dollars to people who have suffered wrongdoing due to other people's negligence. Our accomplishments include the following:

•A $1 million award in a wrongful death case

•A $1 million award following a motor vehicle accident

•A $675,000 award in a case involving a slip and fall

While these victories are significant, they are simply a reflection of the hard work and dedication we put into every case. The team at our law firm combines decades of experience in negotiating and litigating matters such as these. Our attorneys have earned honors such as being members of the Million Dollar Advocates Forum; holding an Avvo "Superb" rating; and being listed in the National Academy of Personal Injury Attorneys' Top 10. Attorney David Ristoff has earned the highest peer rating possible of AV Preeminent* from Martindale-Hubbell, and attorney Stephen R. Williams has earned the peer rating of Martindale-Hubbell Distinguished.

Williams, Ristoff & Proper, P.L.C., offers free initial consultations. We also accept credit cards.

Williams, Ristoff & Proper, P.L.C., is a debt relief agency. We help people seek bankruptcy protection under the U.S. Bankruptcy Code.

* AV®, AV Preeminent®, Martindale-Hubbell Distinguished and Martindale-Hubbell Notable are certification marks used under license in accordance with the Martindale-Hubbell certification procedures, standards and policies. Martindale-Hubbell® is the facilitator of a peer review rating process. Ratings reflect the anonymous opinions of members of the bar and the judiciary. Martindale-Hubbell® Peer Review Rating™ fall into two categories – legal ability and general ethical standards.
